de.kerner.commons.exec
Interface ProcessRunner

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractProcessRunner, AbstractProgrammRunner
public interface ProcessRunner

An implementation of this interface is used to create and execute operating system processes.

Usually and implementation of ProcessRunner will be a wrapper class for ProcessBuilder. It will unify and simplify usage of ProcessBuilder by standardizing the redirection of stdout and stderr, as well as waiting for end of execution. Canceling or asynchronous execution of processes is not possible via a ProcessRunner.

Author:
Alexander Kerner
See Also:
Process, ProcessBuilder, CommandStringBuilder

Method Detail

getCommandList

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCommandList()

Returns the command line string that is used to execute the operating system process.

Example:

find / -iname "*kern*"
Will execute find command with parameters. Splitting this command string at whitespaces will give all list elements.

Returns:
a List of Strings, that contains the command line strings
See Also:
List

createAndRun

int createAndRun(java.io.OutputStream out,
                 java.io.OutputStream err)
                 throws java.lang.Exception

Creates and executes the process. stdout and stderr are redirected to out and err.

Parameters:
out - OutputStream, to which stdout of process is redirected to
err - OutputStream, to which stderr of process is redirected to
Returns:
exit code of process
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if anything goes wrong
